page.title: 16THE PLYMSTOCK FIRE STATION
page.content: The Plymstock Fire Station is one of the many fire stations in Devon. It has one{fire engine}that cost Â£70,000, but more equipment must be bought. This costs Â£15,000 making a total of Â£85,000. During a period of 12 months the fire station takes 118 fire calls and 38 special service calls (cats out of trees,etc.,) There are 400 gallons of water in the tank of the fire engine. Each water hose is 75ft long. The station is manned 24 hours a day in four shifts. There are 6 men on each shift, just enough to go in one fire engine. One is the driver, one is the dogs-body, one is in charge : the rest just help to put out the fire.The nearby{police station}has two cars and reports that the{crimes}they deal with most are theft and drunkenness.
